intro: Noaea major, commonly known as the common tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Noaea major is known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
